intro: Tapura letestui, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered in racemes, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy. Tapura letestui thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a subject of botanical interest.
